page.title: 01General Description - Oakley
page.content: he area is predominately either farm crops-maize,wheat,rape and barley,or rough pasture for grazing of cattle and sheep.However much of the land is covered by forest and nature reserves with rare species of flora and fauna. There are numerous public footpaths across the area.Apart from in the village centre, most buildings are connected with farming. Buildings in Oakley date from 1660 with many timber-framed, thatched cottages.The village has grown considerably over recent years with a large new owner-occupier housing estate.There are limited amenities in the area, which include a primary school, village hall,supermaket, post office, garage, two pubs and several small nurseries.There is a remote sewage works,and remains of a second World War air strip.
